title: Help Identifying this typeface!!!!
content:
Hey!

I really need help identifying this font! I was told by my other designer that it was Bickham Script but its totalllly not!

Any help would be very appreciated!

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007164029im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/fontquestion_6409.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Inacopia logo simple sans - Univers {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007164029/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42877 "Go to previous forum topic") ["The Harbour Hotel" handwritten script ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007164029/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42871 "Go to next forum topic")
author: default720

comments.content:
John, welcome to Typophile.

In the future, please keep the yelling to a minimum. Everyone’s Type ID needs are attended to in a timely manner with the same level of “urgency”. You did well posting in the Type ID forum and including a well sized image. Your topic title should reflect this.

We’re a humble and mostly quite community, so try and keep it to a dull roar in the future.

Enjoy your stay, hopefully you’ll continue to contribute.

Is this the Attitude ID board? When were the shout police formed?

I GUESS WE SHOULD BE GRATEFUL THAT IT WASN’T ALL CAPS!!!!

And we didn’t even ID the font!

Steve, Andrew definitely has a point: there’s even a [FAQ on this](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007164029/http:/typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq/#Q_2): What do I enter in the “Title” line?
Try to define your type ID request as clearly as possible. For example “1960’s newspaper headline face” or “Lost in Translation movie logo” or “retro script” will do nicely. Whereas “Please help me identify this font” is pretty pointless as that’s the only thing we do on the Type Identification Board. Compare it to a newspaper where every single headline would say “Stuff happened!” Accurate descriptions do help, both in identifying and finding things later. Exclamation marks don’t. And we didn’t even ID the font! Huh?

\> And we didn’t even ID the font!

FLORIAN DID!!! FIRST REPLY!!!

Steve, Florian did ID it as Savoye.

I’m also grateful he didn’t use all caps.
My bad. I see that you nailed it.
